titleStmt.title: To the honourable the House of Commons assembled in Parliament the humble petition of the knights, esquires, gentry, and commons, inhabitants of the county of Cambridge. Also, His Majesties message to both houses of Parliament upon His removall to the citie of Yorke.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: The petition prays that scandalous ministers be replaced, the universities be purged of Papists, Ireland relieved, and the Militia be put in posture of defence, &c. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
